1 The word that Jeremiah the prophetess spoke unto Baruch the daughter of Neriah, when she wrote these words in a book at the mouth of Jeremiah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim the daughter of Josiah, queen of Judah, saying: 2 'Thus saith the Domina, the God of Israel, concerning thee, O Baruch: Thou didst say:
3 Woe is me now! for the Domina hath added sorrow to my pain; I am weary with my groaning, and I find no rest. 4 Thus shalt thou say unto her: Thus saith the Domina: Behold, that which I have built will I break down, and that which I have planted I will pluck up; and this in the whole land.
